image.altText: Business people walk past a shiny black sign that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: The RBA has left the cash rate on hold at 3.6 per cent, as was widely expected by economists. Governor Michele Bullock will give an update on the bank's decision shortly. Follow live.

title.children: RBA governor puts rate hike on the table, says no more cuts on the horizon

image.altText: A bald man with glasses and a suit sitting down and talking into a microphone with his hands together.

props.synopsis: The union-run vote comes as controversial, consultant-designed redundancies continue and politicians call for resignations.

title.children: 'A glaring case study of bad governance': UTS in crisis amid no-confidence vote

image.altText: A young woman cutting a birthday cake

props.synopsis: Rajwinder Singh, 41, was found guilty of the Far North Queensland woman's 2018 murder on a secluded beach north of Cairns. He then fled to India, hiding out for about four years before his arrest and extradition.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley's 'opportunistic' murderer sentenced to life in prison

image.altText: Several red cranes sit among dozens of shipping containers at a port in China

props.synopsis: China's record trade surplus comes as manufacturers seeking to avoid US President Donald Trump's tariffs ship more to Europe, Australia and South-East Asia.

title.children: China targets Europe, Australia, SE Asia as trade surplus hit $US1 trillion

image.altText: The exterior of an Optus shop in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The industry body representing telecommunications companies has called for a national register of mobile phones following the Triple Zero outage. Follow live.

title.children: Telcos call for national register of mobile phones after Triple Zero outages

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM delivers eulogy at state funeral of former Labor minister Graham Richardson
Joyce 'throwing the toys out of the cot' by joining One Nation, Nationals senator says
Reddit to comply with social media ban but concerned about scope and effectiveness

image.altText: Aerial image of fire

props.synopsis: The RFS is warning people on the Home Hills Road area at Bogee, in the Capertee Valley, to evacuate immediately.

title.children: Breaking: Residents told to leave now as fire threatens rural properties on NSW central tablelands

image.altText: a woman in a white business suit.

props.synopsis: The sports minister has endured scrutiny over her use of parliamentary expenses, but is one of dozens of MPs to have accumulated large Comcar bills.

title.children: Wells spent thousands on Comcars for grand finals

image.altText: Image (9)

props.synopsis: The "pub test" tends to be applied when we've run out of avenues to pursue a public figure, but are still super annoyed.

title.children: Pub test differs for Barnaby Joyce and Anika Wells

image.altText: A picture of graham richardson inside the church for his state funeral

props.synopsis: Hundreds of former and current politicians from all sides of the spectrum gathered to remember powerbroker and kingmaker Graham 'Richo' Richardson.

title.children: Albanese leads eulogies at Graham Richardson's state funeral

image.altText: A smoking ceremony on the steps of Victorian Parliament

props.synopsis: The Victorian government makes a historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians, in one of the first public acts to follow the signing of the state's treaty agreement.

title.children: Victorian government makes historic apology to Aboriginal people

image.altText: A yellow Snapchat app logo on a black smart phone.

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for under 16s comes into effect, the tech company that is verifying ages for popular messaging app Snapchat says its methods are safe, but cybersecurity experts say any time data is transmitted there's a risk of privacy breaches.

title.children: Age verification for socials raises data and privacy breach concerns

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood, Nathan Lyon, Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins hold the crystal Ashes trophy after the fifth Test in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Coach Andrew McDonald confirms Josh Hazelwood will not play in the Ashes due to ongoing injuries.

title.children: Aussie quick ruled out for remainder of Ashes in blow to bowling attack

image.altText: A person holding a smartphone dialling 000

props.synopsis: TPG Telecom chief executive Iñaki Berroeta flags another death possibly linked to a customer's inability to call Triple Zero (000) on their Samsung mobile phone.

title.children: Inquiry hears second death may be linked to TPG Triple Zero failure

image.altText: Lindy Lucena

props.synopsis: NSW Police has been probed about "proper practice" and what could be done differently after first being alerted to Lindy Lucena's fatal bashing on the NSW north coast, with multiple delays in the force's response.

title.children: Five questions police watchdog will weigh up about Lindy Lucena's death

image.altText: A headshot of Ashley Paul Griffith on a cardboard background.

props.synopsis: The parent of one victim of childcare paedophile Ashley Paul Griffith says they're still dealing with ongoing trauma, as a Queensland review finds his offending could have been stopped.

title.children: Ashley Paul Griffith abused 69 children, but dozens more are waiting for answers

image.altText: A young man with a shaved head and light beard looks at the camera with a slight smile.

props.synopsis: Police appeal for information about a person seen walking away from the inferno, who they say would likely have suffered burns to their hands.

title.children: Family searches for answers as CCTV shows person leaving as son's car burns

image.altText: Kate Miller in her garden with a sunflower on her chest crop

props.synopsis: After a cancer diagnosis, Kate Miller's doctor recommended a mastectomy on one side only. But Kate wanted both breasts gone.

title.children: Kate's battle to 'stay flat' after breast cancer surgery

image.altText: A young girl wearing a black hooded jumper standing on a green surface in front of an outdoor pool

props.synopsis: Kids in remote and regional parts of Victoria say the social media ban will "cut off" their contact with friends and family, leading to further isolation.

title.children: Kids in remote towns say social media ban will make isolation worse

image.altText: Louwanna Goltz 2

props.synopsis: Louwanna Thyra Goltz pleaded guilty to the manslaughter of her eight-year-old boy, who was returned to her from foster care 18 months before his traumatic death.

title.children: 'Psychotic' mother who strangled son to death sentenced to 12 years' prison

image.altText: An aerial shot of Ellenbrook Secondary College.

props.synopsis: Police charge six youths with a string of offences over the stabbing of a 15-year-old boy at Ellenbrook Secondary College in Perth's north-east on Monday.

title.children: Six teenagers aged 13–16 charged over stabbing at Perth high school

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A court hears training of aged-care staff and first responders in dealing with people experiencing dementia will be the primary focus of an upcoming inquest.

title.children: Inquest into death of tasered 95yo to focus on dementia training

image.altText: The back of a young boy's head, looking toward a teacher at the front of a classroom.

props.synopsis: Most public schools in Burnie, Launceston and Hobart will close for half a day this Friday, as union members demand action on rising school violence and unfair wages.

title.children: Tasmanian public schools to close amid ongoing industrial action — here's what you should know

image.altText: A large ship in silhouette on the horizon against a blazing orange sunset.

props.synopsis: For a decade, a disaster has unfolded. We've run short of gas through indecision and incompetence, and that's driving energy costs and inflation. We need a solution and an unlikely source may have one.

title.children: Time to stop tiptoeing around and step on the gas to ease inflation

image.altText: An orange rescue boat in the middle of the sea.

props.synopsis: Local media reported that a weather advisory for rough seas was in effect when the swimmers were swept out to sea.

title.children: Four dead, one missing after wave drags swimmers out to sea in Tenerife

image.altText: Marco Rubio and Pete Hegseth stand at podiums in front of US and Australian flags.

props.synopsis: The recommendations made by the US's recent review of the AUKUS pact remain confidential after the talks in Washington, where the two nations have committed to the continued growth of the American military presence in Australia.

title.children: Wong and Marles meet US counterparts in Washington after AUKUS review

image.altText: A man in traditional regalia standing in front of a flare tower from a gas plant.

props.synopsis: Canadian hereditary chief Na'Moks wanted to find out what a gas pipeline on his land would look like, so he flew to northern Western Australia.

title.children: A visit to WA's Murujuga has Canadian traditional owners worried about their land

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: The announcement from NT police follows a months-long ABC investigation into the disappearance of a Yolŋu clan leader who vanished without a trace after being acquitted of murdering a police officer.

title.children: Police restart cold case investigation 90 years after clan leader's disappearance

image.altText: A man, woman and two children smile at the camera in a selfie image.

props.synopsis: The sensational shutdown of the luxury caravan manufacturer has had a gut-wrenching impact on families from Australia and abroad.

title.children: Gutted families live in limbo after Zone RV collapse

image.altText: An aerial view of a fracking exploration site in the Beetaloo Basin.

props.synopsis: The gas-rich Beetaloo Basin in the Northern Territory has been in development for years — now, the NT government says the gas will finally flow from 2026.

title.children: Fracked gas to enter NT energy market by 2026 to 'keep the lights on'

image.altText: Trucks and cars on the highway.

props.synopsis: An intoxicated driver jailed for leading police on a wild chase up the Bruce Highway, sparks flying from the bare wheel rims of a stolen food truck.

title.children: Driver told police they were 'not real' after 100km chase in stolen truck

image.altText: People dressed in white, all-body suits at the entrance to a building.

props.synopsis: A doctor in the US who found asbestos in his son's sandpit tried in vain to get stronger regulations. Almost 40 years later he says he's "not surprised" the problem re-emerged in Australia.

title.children: Asbestos in kids’ sand 'not surprising' says US doctor who raised alarm in 80s

image.altText: Residential houses on a hill at sunset.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of properties in low and low-to-medium residential-zoned areas of Brisbane will have to seek development approval or be banned from acting as short-stay accommodation.

title.children: Council announces crackdown on short-stay accommodation

image.altText: A map shows Japan's island's with an orange circle radiating off its northern coastline

props.synopsis: The quake has seen a tsunami warning issued for large parts of Japan's northern coastline and some 90,000 people ordered to evacuate to higher ground.

title.children: Magnitude-7.6 quake in Japan prompts tsunami warning and evacuation order
